conclusion: To determine whether Object A and Object B have the same acceleration at time t1, we need to analyze their velocity-time graphs.
Object A's velocity-time graph is shown in the diagram.
Object B's velocity-time graph is also shown in the diagram.
At time t1, Object A is moving with a velocity of v0.
The velocity of Object A decreases over time, approaching zero at t1.
Object B starts with a velocity of v0 and increases its velocity over time.
Object B's velocity increases until it reaches a maximum velocity of v0 at t2.
After t2, Object B's velocity decreases over time, approaching zero at t4.
At time t1, Object A is moving with a constant velocity of v0.
Object B is also moving with a constant velocity of v0 at t1.
Since Object A and Object B are moving with the same velocity of v0 at time t1, they have the same acceleration at that point.
Object A and Object B have the same acceleration at time t1.
